0.user_question: Sirius: Brightest star in the night sky. Is Sirius part of a constellation of an animal?

ost_step.1: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky, also known as the "Dog Star," because it lies in the constellation Canis Major (Greater Dog).
ost_step.2: Constellations are patterns of stars recognized since ancient times, and different cultures have assigned various names and shapes to them, often based on mythological creatures and stories.
ost_step.3: In the case of Sirius, its name "Dog Star" and the constellation Canis Major indicate that it is indeed part of a constellation representing a dog.

The answer is: true.
